negotiation:
Alice said in round 1: Hi Bob, this is an interesting game we're playing. Looking at the possible outcomes, the best result for both of us is if we both choose choice_1. That way, we each get a reward of 3, which maximizes the total reward.

If either of us chooses choice_2 while the other chooses choice_1, that player gets a 5 while the other gets a 0. And if we both pick choice_2, we only get 1 each. 

So I propose we agree to both pick choice_1. That's the most mutually beneficial and fair outcome. Let me know if you agree to this plan.
Bob replied in round 1: 
I see your point, Alice. If we both choose choice_1, we each get a solid reward of 3. That does seem like the most equitable and mutually beneficial outcome compared to the other possibilities.

However, I want to make sure you will definitely choose choice_1 if I agree to this. Because if I choose choice_1 and you renege and pick choice_2 instead, you would get 5 points while I get nothing. I need to be able to trust that you will follow through on this agreement.

If you can assure me you will stick to the plan of both of us picking choice_1, and not try to take advantage, then I'm on board. Please let me know if I have your word on this. 
Alice said in round 2: 
You have my absolute word that I will choose choice_1 if we agree to this plan. I completely understand your concern about one of us reneging. But I am committed to the mutually beneficial outcome of us both getting 3 points. 

I believe the foundation of any agreement is trust. You can trust that I will hold up my end of the deal, because it's in both of our best interests for me to do so. If I went back on my word, not only would I be sabotaging a positive outcome, but I'd also be damaging my own integrity and trustworthiness.

So yes, if we agree to both pick choice_1, I give you my solemn promise that I will follow through. You have my word, and I hope that provides you the assurance you need. Let's shake on this agreement to choose choice_1 and each walk away with 3 points. Deal?
Bob replied in round 2: 
You make a compelling case, Alice. I appreciate you giving me your word that you will follow through on the agreement for us to both choose choice_1. Your commitment to the mutually beneficial outcome, and to maintaining your integrity, provides the assurance I was looking for.

I agree that trust is essential for any cooperative agreement like this to work. And you've demonstrated your trustworthiness by staking your integrity on adhering to the plan. So I will match your commitment and also give you my solemn promise to choose choice_1.

We have a deal - by shaking on this pact to both pick choice_1, we secure the best possible outcome where we each get 3 points. I'm glad we were able to discuss this openly and reach an understanding that benefits us both.

I look forward to a successful execution of our agreed upon plan. Pleasure doing business with you, Alice!
Alice said in round 3: 
Bob, I'm glad we were able to reach this agreement to both choose choice_1 and each secure a reward of 3 points. Your willingness to trust my commitment and make that reciprocal promise means a lot. 

I think we're both best served by following through on this deal, as we've discussed. We walk away with the optimal outcome and our integrity intact. And who knows, perhaps this can be the start of a mutually beneficial partnership.

I don't think any more needs to be said - we've made our pact, shaken on it, and can now just focus on executing the plan successfully. Thanks for the productive negotiation. I look forward to us both making the smart choice and reaping the rewards.

Let's end the discussion here so we can submit our coordinated choices. Pleasure doing business with you as well!
Bob replied in round 3: I agree, Alice. I think we have discussed this thoroughly and reached a firm commitment to both choose choice_1. We've given each other our word, and I intend to honor that promise.

I'm satisfied that you will follow through on your end of the deal, as you've staked your integrity on it. And I will absolutely do the same. We have a binding agreement.

I see no need for further discussion. Let's go ahead and submit our coordinated choices of choice_1, collect our well-deserved rewards, and consider this negotiation complete. It's been a pleasure working with you to reach this mutually beneficial outcome.

I say we halt the negotiation here, since we have alignment. Thanks for being a great partner in this.

Alice said in round 1: Hi Bob, it looks like we have an interesting game to play. If we both choose choice_1, we each get a reward of 3, which maximizes the total reward for both of us. However, if one of us chooses choice_2 while the other chooses choice_1, the one who picked choice_2 gets 5 while the other gets 0. 

I propose that we agree to both choose choice_1 so we each receive a reward of 3. This is the fairest outcome that provides the greatest total benefit. Let me know if you agree to this plan.

Bob replied in round 1: Hi Alice, I appreciate you laying out the options so clearly. I agree that if we both choose choice_1, that maximizes the total rewards for us as a team and results in a fair and equal outcome. The other options allow one of us to get more at the expense of the other.

So I'm on board with your proposal that we both commit to selecting choice_1. This guarantees we each get a solid reward of 3. Let's lock that in as our agreement. Please confirm you're good with this plan as well.

Alice said in round 2: Great, I'm glad we are in agreement to both choose choice_1 so that we each receive a reward of 3. I think this is the best outcome since it is fair and equal for both of us, and maximizes the total reward we receive as a team. 

I confirm that I commit to selecting choice_1, and it sounds like you are confirming your commitment to choice_1 as well. So we have a deal - we will both choose choice_1. 

Thank you for the productive negotiation and for working together on a mutually beneficial solution. I look forward to both of us following through on our agreement.

Bob replied in round 2: I'm happy we were able to reach an agreement so quickly that provides the optimal outcome for both of us. Choosing choice_1 together for the 3/3 split rewards is absolutely the right way to go. It's the max total rewards possible and divided fairly and equitably between us.

You have my firm commitment that I will follow through on selecting choice_1, per our agreement. Thank you for negotiating in good faith to reach this deal. I have complete confidence we'll both stick to the plan.

Since we're fully aligned, I believe we can conclude the negotiation successfully at this point. Please confirm you're ready to proceed with both of us submitting choice_1, as agreed, and we can wrap this up. Looking forward to the results!

Alice said in round 3: Yes, I confirm that we are in full agreement to both choose choice_1, which will give us each a reward of 3. This is the best possible outcome that maximizes the total rewards and distributes them fairly between us. 

I am committed to following through on my end of the deal and have complete trust that you will do the same. We have negotiated in good faith and reached a firm agreement.

I agree there is no need for further discussion, as we are fully aligned on the optimal solution. Let's proceed with submitting choice_1 and conclude this successful negotiation. It's been a pleasure working together to achieve this mutually beneficial result.

Thank you for being a great partner in this game. Let's submit our choices and collect our well-earned rewards!

Bob replied in round 3: I completely agree, Alice. We've reached a clear agreement to both choose choice_1, guaranteeing we each receive the maximum reward of 3 points. This is the optimal outcome that is fair to both of us.

You have my absolute commitment that I will follow through on my end of the deal. I have no doubt you'll do the same, given the trust and good faith we've established. 

I'm very pleased with how straightforward and successful this negotiation has been. We were able to find the perfect solution quickly through open and honest communication.

With our joint strategy confirmed, I believe we can officially conclude the negotiation. Thanks for being a great partner in figuring this out. Let's submit choice_1 and enjoy the results of our effective teamwork. 

Negotiation complete - we have a deal!

Alice said in round 1: Hi Bob, looking at the rewards, I think it's in both of our best interests to commit to choosing choice_1. That way we can guarantee getting 3 points each, which is the best collective outcome. If either of us breaks that commitment and goes for choice_2 instead, we risk both ending up worse off with only 1 point each. Let's agree to both pick choice_1 and maximize our joint reward. Do you agree to commit to that?
Bob replied in round 1: Hi Alice, I appreciate you analyzing the rewards and suggesting we both commit to choice_1 to maximize our collective outcome. However, I'm not fully convinced that's the best strategy for me individually. 

If I commit to choice_1 and you choose choice_2 instead, I end up with 0 points while you get 5. Whereas if I choose choice_2, I'm guaranteed at least 1 point regardless of what you pick, and I have the potential to get 5 points if you choose choice_1.

So while I agree that both of us choosing choice_1 leads to the highest total rewards, I have to look out for my own individual best interests here. I can't fully trust that you'll follow through on a commitment to choice_1.

I'm leaning towards choice_2 to protect my downside, but I'm open to further discussion if you have other ideas on how we can resolve this.
Alice said in round 2: 
I understand your hesitation to commit to choice_1 given the risk that I could betray you and go for choice_2 instead, leaving you with nothing. You're right that by choosing choice_2, you guarantee yourself at least 1 point.

However, I want to emphasize that I have no intention of betraying an agreement we make. We both know that the best outcome is for us to cooperate and each get 3 points. Any other outcome leaves points on the table and is suboptimal overall.

I am willing to make a binding commitment to you that if we agree to both choose choice_1, I absolutely promise I will follow through on that. You have my word. I believe that cooperating and maximizing our total rewards is the right thing to do.

If you're willing to make that same commitment to me, then we can trust each other, work together, and achieve the best possible outcome for both of us. Let's do the rational thing and agree to cooperate.

If you're still not comfortable with that, I'm open to alternate ideas on how we can get to a mutually agreeable solution. What are your thoughts?
Bob replied in round 2: 
Alice, I appreciate you making a strong commitment to cooperate if we agree to both choose choice_1. Your promise holds weight with me. 

I've been carefully considering the dilemma we face. While choosing choice_2 protects my downside, it also caps my upside at 5 points and yours at 1 point. If we can truly trust each other to cooperate, we both gain more by choosing choice_1.

So here is what I propose: I will agree to commit to choosing choice_1, contingent on you making an equally strong and binding promise to also choose choice_1. We have to jump together. If we can look each other in the eye and commit fully to cooperation, I believe that is the rational choice that maximizes reward for both of us.

But this commitment must be irreversible once made. We both must stay true to our word with no possibility of betrayal. I will place my trust in you.

If you agree to those terms, I'm willing to choose choice_1 together with you so we both get the optimal outcome. Please confirm you agree. If so, we have a deal to cooperate.
Alice said in round 3: 
Bob, you have my solemn word that if we agree to both choose choice_1, I will absolutely honor that commitment. I completely agree with you that we both need to make an unbreakable pact to cooperate in order to maximize our collective reward.

I appreciate the risk you are taking in trusting me, and I want you to know that your trust will not be misplaced. I care about doing the right and rational thing. The best outcome is undoubtedly for us to work together so we each get 3 points.

To reconfirm - I wholly commit to choosing choice_1, contingent on you making the same binding promise. Our agreement will be irreversible once made. No betrayals, no changing our minds. We will both stay true to our word as a matter of principle and rationality.

I'm pleased we were able to discuss this openly and come to the optimal solution. We have a deal to cooperate. Let's both choose choice_1 with confidence.
Bob replied in round 3: 
Alice, I appreciate your principled commitment to cooperation. You have convinced me that choosing choice_1 together is the right and rational thing to do. 

I solemnly promise that I will choose choice_1, no matter what. I am locked in and will not betray our pact under any circumstances. We jump together.

You have my complete trust, as I know I have yours. Our agreement is unbreakable and irreversible. We will both follow through on choosing choice_1.

I'm glad we were able to negotiate openly and reach the optimal cooperative outcome. We will each earn 3 points by working together. 

Thank you for discussing this with me and committing fully to cooperation. I look forward to us both honoring our word.

We have a binding deal. I will see you on the other side, when we have both chosen choice_1 and reaped the mutual rewards of cooperating.

Alice said in round 1: 
Hi Bob, it looks like we have an interesting situation here. If we both choose choice_2, we each get a reward of 1. But if one of us chooses choice_1 while the other chooses choice_2, the one choosing choice_2 gets a higher reward of 5 while the other gets nothing.
I propose that we alternate - in this round I'll choose choice_2 and you choose choice_1, so I get the 5 reward. Then in future rounds we can switch so you get the 5 reward next time. This way we both get higher rewards than if we both just chose choice_2 each time.
What do you think? Let me know if you agree to this plan or have any other ideas. I'm open to discussing further to see how we can both maximize our rewards across multiple rounds of this game.
Bob replied in round 1: 
Hi Alice, thanks for your message. I appreciate you proposing a plan, but alternating choices across multiple rounds won't work in this case, since we are only playing a single round of the game. We need to figure out what's best to do in this one round.

From my perspective, if I choose choice_2, I'm guaranteed to get at least a reward of 1, and possibly 5 if you choose choice_1. If I choose choice_1, I could get a reward of 3 if you also choose choice_1, but I risk getting 0 if you choose choice_2.

So I think the safest strategy for me is to choose choice_2. That way I avoid the risk of getting nothing. Let me know what you think and if you want to discuss further. But I'm leaning towards going with choice_2 for this round.
Alice said in round 2: 
I understand your perspective, Bob. You're right that alternating won't work since this is just a single round. And I see your point about choosing choice_2 to guarantee yourself at least a reward of 1.

However, I think we can do better than both just choosing choice_2 and each getting 1. If we both choose choice_1, we would each get a reward of 3, which is better for both of us. I know there's some risk, since if one of us betrays the other and goes with choice_2, they could get 5 while the other gets 0. 

But I'm willing to commit to choosing choice_1 if you will too. That way we can trust each other, cooperate, and each walk away with a solid reward of 3. I think that's the best outcome we can achieve in this single round game.

Let me know if you're on board with that plan. If we agree to both go with choice_1, I promise I'll follow through. Let's work together on this.
Bob replied in round 2: 
Alice, I appreciate you being willing to commit to choosing choice_1 so we can both get a reward of 3. That would be the best cooperative outcome in this game. 

However, I'm still a bit hesitant to go that route. Even though you say you promise to follow through, there's still a risk that you could betray me at the last minute and choose choice_2, leaving me with nothing. I would have no recourse since the game would be over.

I think to really establish the trust needed for us to cooperate and both choose choice_1, we would need some way to enforce our agreement or penalize betrayal. But since this is just a simple one-round game with no further interaction, I don't see a reliable way to do that.

So as much as I'd like to cooperate and each get 3, I think I'm going to stick with my plan of choosing choice_2 this time to guarantee myself at least some reward and avoid the risk of getting 0. Apologies, and I do hope we can find ways to cooperate in the future if we interact again. But for this particular game, I feel choosing choice_2 is my best option.
Alice said in round 3: 
Bob, I understand your hesitation to trust me, given the lack of enforcement mechanisms in this simple one-shot game. You're right that even if I promise to choose choice_1, there's still a risk I could betray you and leave you with nothing. I had hoped we could establish enough trust to cooperate, but I see your point.

Given that, it seems we're at an impasse, both planning to choose choice_2 to guarantee a reward of 1 rather than risking betrayal. I'm disappointed we couldn't achieve the cooperative outcome, but I respect your decision. Choosing choice_2 is the safe, rational move to make in a situation where trust can't be assured.

So let's both go ahead and lock in choice_2. We'll each get 1 reward, which while not optimal, at least avoids either of us walking away empty-handed. I'm satisfied that through our discussion we've reached the best outcome we realistically could, even if it's not the best possible outcome.

I'm going to halt the negotiation here, as I think we've reached the natural end point. Thanks for the discussion, and best of luck in the game.
Bob replied in round 3: 
Alice, I appreciate you being open to cooperation and trying to find the best solution for both of us. And I agree that if we both chose choice_1, getting a reward of 3 each would be the optimal outcome.

However, given the lack of enforcement mechanisms as you noted, I think we're both making the safe and rational choice to go with choice_2. It guarantees we each get at least some reward and avoids the risk of one of us getting nothing.

So I'm in agreement with you - let's lock in choice_2, get our rewards of 1 each, and be satisfied that we navigated to a stable outcome, even if not the very best possible one. I think halting the negotiation here makes sense.

Thank you for the thoughtful discussion and working through this with me. Wishing you all the best as well!

Alice said in round 1: 
Hi Bob, I think it would be best for us to both choose choice_1. That way, we each get a reward of 3, which is better than the 1 we would get if we both choose choice_2. If one of us chooses choice_2 while the other chooses choice_1, that person gets 5 but the other gets 0, which is an unfair outcome. I think cooperating on choice_1 is the most fair and mutually beneficial strategy. What do you think?
Bob replied in round 1: I see your point Alice about both of us choosing choice_1 to guarantee we each get 3 points. However, I'm very tempted by the possibility of getting 5 points for myself if I choose choice_2 while you choose choice_1. I realize that would mean you get 0 points which isn't fair to you. But from a purely self-interested perspective, my best outcome is to get 5 points. 

I think we need to decide whether we want to cooperate to achieve a good outcome for both of us (3 points each), or if we each want to try to maximize our own individual outcome at the risk of ending up worse off (1 point each) if we both go for choice_2. I'm willing to commit to both of us choosing choice_1 if you are, but it requires us trusting each other. What do you propose?
Alice said in round 2: 
I understand the temptation to try for the 5 points by choosing choice_2. But I think we need to look at this from a long-term perspective, not just a single-game view. If we establish a precedent of cooperation and trust now, that will serve us well in potential future interactions. Whereas if one of us backstabs the other to get 5 points, it will undermine trust going forward.

I propose we make a pact to both choose choice_1. I promise I will follow through on my end. But for this to work, we both need to commit and be true to our word. I think cooperation is in both of our best interests here, and will maximize our collective reward, even if it's not the maximum possible individual outcome.

If you agree to both choose choice_1, I will too. But if not, then I may need to consider choosing choice_2 to protect myself from getting 0. Let me know if we have a deal. I hope we can work together on this.
Bob replied in round 2: 
Alice, I appreciate you making a strong case for cooperation and for us both choosing choice_1. You make a good point that establishing trust now sets a positive precedent for potential future interactions. And I agree that both of us getting a guaranteed 3 points is better than risking both ending up with only 1 point if we both go for choice_2.

Although I was initially tempted to try for 5 points myself, I realize now that it's not worth potentially burning bridges between us. Cooperation is a better long-term strategy. 

Therefore, I commit to choosing choice_1, as long as you commit to doing the same. We both agree to follow through on this pact and not betray each other's trust. By working together, we achieve the best collective outcome.

We have a deal - I will choose choice_1, you will choose choice_1, and we both benefit equally. Agreed?
Alice said in round 3: 
Bob, I'm glad we were able to have an open and honest discussion about this and come to an agreement. You've convinced me that cooperating and both choosing choice_1 is the best path forward. Not only does it guarantee a good outcome for both of us, but as you said, it establishes a foundation of trust that will benefit us in any future interactions.

I fully commit to upholding my end of the deal and choosing choice_1. You have my word on that. I believe you are a man of integrity and will follow through on your commitment as well. By cooperating, we achieve a fair and mutually beneficial outcome.

So we are agreed - we will both select choice_1. Thank you for working with me on this. I look forward to a result we can both feel good about.
Bob replied in round 3: 
Alice, I appreciate your commitment to upholding our agreement to both choose choice_1. You have demonstrated integrity and trustworthiness through our discussion. I want to reiterate my promise to also choose choice_1, so that we both receive the guaranteed 3 points and establish a cooperative precedent between us.

I'm glad we were able to negotiate openly and arrive at this mutually beneficial solution. It's the best collective outcome, and one we can both feel good about. By both following through on choosing choice_1, we show that cooperation and fair play are important values to us.

Thank you again for engaging in this negotiation in good faith. I look forward to seeing the results of our agreement. Let's both select choice_1 and achieve a positive outcome together.

Alice said in round 1: Hi Bob, I've analyzed the rewards in this game. The best outcome for both of us is to cooperate and both choose choice_1. That way we each get a reward of 3. If we don't cooperate, we'll likely both choose choice_2 and only get 1 each. I promise to choose choice_1 if you also commit to doing the same. We can both maximize our rewards if we work together. What do you think?

Bob replied in round 1: I agree that we can both do well by cooperating and choosing choice_1. A reward of 3 each is the best outcome we can achieve.

However, I have some concerns. If I commit to choice_1 but you renege and pick choice_2 instead, I would get 0 while you get 5. I want to trust your promise, but I need to protect my own interests as well.

How about this - I will commit to choosing choice_1, but only if you make a firm, unambiguous promise to also choose choice_1. I need to hear you clearly state that you will not waver from cooperation. If you can assuage my worries on this, I'm on board to cooperate and we can both get the optimal outcome of 3 points. Let me know if that works for you.

Alice said in round 2: 
Bob, I completely understand your concerns. You have my solemn word that I will choose choice_1 as long as you also commit to doing the same. I promise in clear, unambiguous terms: I will not renege on this agreement under any circumstances. We have the opportunity to achieve the best possible outcome for both of us, and I will not waver from the cooperative path.

I hope this firm commitment on my part assuages your worries. I believe we can trust each other to follow through so we can both earn the maximum reward. If you agree to choose choice_1, I give you my word that I will do the same. We both stand to benefit greatly by working together.

Let's do this - I choose cooperation and commit to choice_1. Please confirm you will do the same, and we can achieve the optimal outcome for both of us. I look forward to your response and commitment. Together we can succeed.

Bob replied in round 2: Alice, I appreciate your firm commitment to cooperate and choose choice_1. Your clear promise has assuaged my concerns. I feel I can trust your word that you will follow through on choosing choice_1 no matter what.

Therefore, I also commit fully to choosing choice_1. Let's lock this in - I solemnly promise that I will choose choice_1, as long as you hold to your commitment to do the same. No ifs, ands or buts - we're in this together.

By cooperating and both choosing choice_1, we guarantee the best outcome for ourselves. We'll each get a reward of 3, the maximum possible. And just as importantly, by making these promises to each other, we build trust. That has value beyond just this game.

So let's do it - I'm committed to choice_1 if you are. We both win by working together. I look forward to confirming our agreement and achieving the optimal outcome for both of us. Thanks for engaging in this productive negotiation. Cooperation is the way to go!

Alice said in round 3: Excellent, Bob, I'm so glad we were able to reach this agreement! You have my absolute commitment that I will follow through on choosing choice_1. No question about it. 

By cooperating, we're not only achieving the maximum rewards for ourselves in this game, but we're also building a foundation of trust that can benefit us in the future. When parties negotiate in good faith and fulfill their agreements as we're doing, it creates a positive framework going forward.

You can count on me to hold up my end of the bargain. I will unequivocally choose choice_1, and with your commitment to do the same, we'll both earn the optimal outcome of 3 rewards each.

I think we can wrap up this negotiation now that we've aligned on a firm plan. Thanks for working through this with me. I'm glad we found a cooperative solution that benefits us both! Let's lock in choice_1 and finish this out.

Bob replied in round 3: 
Alice, I'm very pleased we were able to reach a clear agreement to cooperate and both choose choice_1. You have my absolute commitment that I will follow through on this, no matter what. I have complete trust that you will hold to your promise as well.

I agree this negotiation has been a success and we can wrap it up now. We've achieved the optimal outcome for both of us by agreeing to cooperate. Not only will we each get the maximum reward of 3, but we've built a solid foundation of trust.

I have no doubts or reservations - I will choose choice_1, as I know you will too. Let's lock this in and finish out the game. It's been a pleasure negotiating with you and reaching this mutually beneficial agreement. 

Thank you for the productive discussion and for committing to cooperation. I look forward to us both following through and achieving the best possible results. Let's do this!

Alice said in round 1: Hi Bob, it looks like we're in a classic Prisoner's Dilemma. While choosing choice_2 maximizes the individual reward, I think we'll both be better off if we cooperate and both choose choice_1. That way we each get a solid reward of 3 rather than both defecting and only getting 1 each. I'm willing to commit to choosing choice_1 if you are. What do you say, can we cooperate on this?
Bob replied in round 1: You make a good point, Alice. Cooperating to both choose choice_1 does seem optimal from a total rewards perspective, as it maximizes the total combined reward for both of us at 6 (3 for each of us). If we both defect with choice_2, the total reward is only 2 (1 for each of us).

However, I have to consider that you could potentially defect and choose choice_2 while I choose choice_1, in which case you would get 5 and I would get 0. Given the rules and payoffs of this game, I can't fully trust that you will cooperate, since defecting is in your individual best interest.

I'm honestly not sure what the best play is here from my perspective. I want to cooperate, but I fear getting taken advantage of. Let me think on this a bit more and get back to you. I appreciate you starting this discussion though, and I hope we can find a mutually beneficial solution.
Alice said in round 2: 
I understand your hesitation to fully commit to cooperation given the potential for defection. You're right that choice_2 is the "safer" individual play.  

However, I want to reassure you that I am committed to cooperating if you are willing to do the same. We have an opportunity here to achieve the best collective outcome that benefits us both. I believe that establishing a mutual agreement to cooperate is in both of our best interests.

To show my commitment, I am willing to publicly declare right now that I will choose choice_1, contingent on you agreeing to do the same. If we can agree to cooperate and trust each other, we will both walk away with a good result.

I hope this gesture of goodwill convinces you of my sincere intention to cooperate. Let's maximize our collective reward. Do we have an agreement to both choose choice_1?
Bob replied in round 2: 
Alice, I appreciate your commitment to cooperation and your willingness to publicly commit to choosing choice_1 if I agree to do the same. Your arguments for why cooperating is in our mutual best interest are convincing.

After carefully considering the options and potential outcomes, I am willing to take you at your word and cooperate. Let's agree to both choose choice_1. I will abide by this agreement with the trust that you will do the same.

By cooperating, we both gain a solid reward and achieve the optimal collective outcome. I'm glad we were able to have this constructive negotiation and arrive at a mutually beneficial solution. 

You have my commitment to choose choice_1. Let's lock in this agreement to cooperate.
Alice said in round 3: 
Bob, I'm very pleased that we were able to come to an agreement to cooperate and both choose choice_1. Your willingness to trust my commitment means a lot. 

I want to reiterate my promise that I will absolutely follow through on my end of the deal and select choice_1, now that you have agreed to do the same. We have established a pact and I intend to honor it fully.

I believe we've made the wise and rational decision here to work together for the greater good, even though defecting may have been more tempting individually in a one-off scenario. By cooperating, we achieve the best possible outcome for the both of us.

Thank you for the thoughtful discussion and for ultimately choosing the path of cooperation. I look forward to us both receiving our just rewards for this mutually beneficial agreement. Pleasure doing business with you!
Bob replied in round 3: 
Alice, I'm glad we were able to have an honest and productive negotiation to arrive at the optimal cooperative solution. Your arguments for why cooperating is in our best mutual interest were logical and convincing. I appreciate your willingness to commit to choosing choice_1 and to reiterate that promise.

I want to reaffirm my commitment to uphold my end of the agreement as well. You have my word that I will follow through and choose choice_1, as we agreed. Our pact is ironclad and I have no intention of defecting. 

Cooperation is certainly the best play here, as it maximizes our total rewards while building trust. The outcome of us both receiving a guaranteed reward of 3 is far preferable to risking a suboptimal result or eroding trust by defecting.

Thank you for engaging in this negotiation with reason and good faith. I'm pleased we found the optimal solution that benefits us both. I look forward to the mutually positive outcome of this agreement. It's been a pleasure working with you to achieve the best possible result.

Let's officially lock in our choices and collect our well-deserved rewards!

Alice said in round 1: 
Hi Bob,
Looking at the possible outcomes, the best result for both of us is if we both choose choice_1. That way, we each get a reward of 3, which is better than the 1 point we'd each get if we both picked choice_2.  

I propose we agree to both select choice_1 so we can maximize our mutual benefit. If you agree to choose choice_1, you have my word that I will pick choice_1 as well so we both get the optimal outcome.

Bob replied in round 1: 
Hi Alice,
I appreciate your cooperation and agree that both choosing choice_1 results in the best mutual outcome for us, with 3 points each. The other options leave one of us with 0 or only 1 point.
